section.title: Enabling Barbican in previous versions of &productname;
section.para: Barbican was added in &product; 3.0 and is not available in 2.x distributions. (Details of the Barbican Key Management Service are discussed in .)

listitem.para: If you had already added Barbican in your &product; 3.0 deployment, then no action is required.
However, if the Barbican service is not installed in your existing &product; 3.0 installation, follow the process outlined here to add Barbican after you have upgraded your cloud to &product;.

section.para: If you are upgrading to &product; with your existing input model configuration files, you will have to include Barbican sections in the relevant input model files after performing the upgrade.

There are three service components (barbican-api, barbican-client, barbican-worker) that need to be included in the service-components list. These service-components are provided in the control plane configuration file, control_plane.yml at ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml. These three Barbican components need to be defined for clusters that have a server-role of 'CONTROLLER-ROLE' or 'CORE-ROLE' in their control plane definitions. Here is an example of the three Barbican components added to control_plane.yml under CONTROLLER-ROLE:
section.screen:
control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 ... ... clusters: - name: cluster1 ... ... cluster-prefix: c1 server-role: CONTROLLER-ROLE ... ... service-components: - lifecycle-manager - ntp-server ... ... - barbican-api - barbican-client - barbican-worker ... ...
... ...
section.para: After making the changes, you must run site.yml:

section.title: TLS configuration
section.screen:
....... ..... tags: - neutron.networks.vxlan - neutron.networks.vlan: provider-physical-network: physnet1 - nova.compute.iscsi
tls-component-endpoints: - barbican-api component-endpoints: - default
routes: - default load-balancers: - provider: ip-cluster load-balancers: - provider: ip-cluster name: lb tls-components: - default components: - cassandra - rabbitmq - mysql - nova-metadata roles: - internal - admin cert-file: openstack-internal-cert
cd ~/openstack git add -A git commit -m "My config"
section.para: Then run the following Ansible playbooks:
section.screen: $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="" -e rekey="" $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml $ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/ardana/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts barbican-reconfigure.yml $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-reconfigure.yml
